definition[0]: the positive part of a situation that is generally bad
example[0]: The upside of the whole thing is that we got a free trip to Jamaica.
definition[1]: the amount that the price of a share, bond etc is expected to rise
example[1]: The bondsâ€™ upside is limited - they are unlikely to rise above 100% of their face value.
example[2]: The stock is at a low and could have upside potential (=could rise).
